perturbation.original_text:
Exhibit A

Customer Relationship Management System Description

The Customer Relationship Management (“CRM”) system entails all aspects of interaction that a company has with its customer, whether it is sales or service-related. It also provides a greater understanding of the customer and helps manage customer data and all interaction with the customer.
Advantages and features of the CRM are as following:


●
Enhanced customer relationship management including retention tools and fraud prevention.




●
Recurring billing feature that allows for fully automated billing and tools to determine approval and decline rates and automated retries of declines.




●
Profit management tools including affiliate commission tracking, price point testing and indemnification of revenue loss causes.




●
Gateway integration and merchant account load balancing.




●
Improved affiliate management and affiliate fraud detection.




●
Better reporting and performance tracking.

perturbation.explanation: By removing all the bulleted points under 'Advantages and features of the CRM', we remove concrete functional descriptions of the CRM system. This contrasts with the contract's purpose of defining the scope of maintenance, making it difficult to determine what exactly LEADER is obligated to maintain. This introduces ambiguity and can lead to disputes.
